column4: hi, is there anyway to install Ubuntu from a Windows laptop without DVD -Drive?
<linuxgeekery>: is there anyway to install from an iso image?
I'm burning the ISO image to the thumbdrive and asking how to do it
does wubi mean that I can install Ubuntu along with Windows without having to repartition the harddrive?
there are many ways, do you have a thumb drive? ( I assume no DVD means no CD also ?)
Yes, but it isn't officially supported
Note though that wubi is not officially supported and may not work as well
What do you mean? It doesn't use the standard install iso but it doesn't require burning a CD
It really depends on the webcam, some work out of the box, others just require firmware to work, the rest are generally PITA
thanks. I'm reading the website ubotu gave me
Have you been using sudo with GUI apps instead of gksudo?
